sentence.Network_en: The procession serenely, like a cortege entering the cemetery gates.
sentence.Network_cn: 它们安详地滑过去, 像送葬队列走进公墓大门时那样.

sentence.Network_en: He was honored with a huge funeral cortege, with all members present in full funeral regalia.
sentence.Network_cn: 他被尊重的放在一个巨大无比的葬礼队伍中,所有随行的人都身着丧服.

entry.def: A cortege is a procession of people who are walking or riding in cars to a funeral.

means.word_mean: 2. the group following and attending to some important person

auth_sentence.content: This morning, Margaret Thatcher's funeral cortege will make its way up Whitehall in a silence that even Big Ben will observe.
auth_sentence.res_content: This morning, Margaret Thatcher's funeral cortege will make its way up Whitehall in a silence that even Big Ben will observe.

auth_sentence.content: Mark Duggan's cortege left his parents' home and made its way through Tottenham's Broadwater Farm Estate to his private funeral.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mark Duggan's cortege left his parents' home and made its way through Tottenham's Broadwater Farm Estate to his private funeral.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mark Duggan's cortege left his parents' home and made its way through Tottenham's Broadwater Farm Estate to his private funeral.

auth_sentence.content: Percy Battershill, 69, from Mitcham, was among the fans watching the cortege, and described Sir Henry as simply "the greatest".
